The revisions aim to remove this benefit, potentially making P-notes less attractive and prompting investors to explore other jurisdictions like the Netherlands or Belgium for similar tax protections.

This approach maintains pressure on trading partners while respecting existing agreements.

articles.summary: India has launched its first comprehensive anti-terror policy named PRAHAAR. This policy addresses threats from cross-border terrorism, cyber-attacks, and the misuse of drones. It highlights the use of advanced technologies by terror groups for propaganda and funding. PRAHAAR emphasizes coordinated legal, technological, and community-based responses to combat evolving security challenges.

articles.title: HAL shares decline 5% on Tejas crash reports; company denies incident

articles.title: One quarter's profit, gone! How IDFC First Bank fell victim to banking's oldest fraud in the age of cyberattacks
articles.summary: IDFC First Bank was rocked by a forged cheque fraud at its Chandigarh branch, triggering a sharp market selloff that wiped out over Rs 14,400 crore in shareholder wealth within hours. The issue surfaced on February 18 when Haryana government entities sought to close certain accounts and transfer funds, revealing discrepancies that led to the discovery of internal fraud. Within days, the fallout hit the bank’s 29 lakh shareholders hard.

articles.title: Indian govt, LIC lose over Rs 1,400 crore in IDFC First Bank market crash
articles.summary: IDFC First Bank shares plunged nearly 20% after the lender disclosed a Rs 590 crore fraud at its Chandigarh branch involving accounts linked to Haryana government entities. The sell-off erased about Rs 14,000 crore in market value and triggered Rs 1,452 crore in combined mark-to-market losses for LIC and the Government of India, raising governance concerns.

articles.title: Gurugram surpasses Mumbai in ultra-luxury sales in 2025
articles.summary: Gurugram led India's luxury housing market in 2025. Transactions for homes over Rs 10 crore reached Rs 24,120 crore. This marks a significant jump from 2023. Gurugram surpassed Mumbai in this segment. The ultra-luxury market formed 24 percent of the city's total residential value. New areas are driving this expansion. Buyer confidence and capital inflows are strong.

articles.title: Tariff uncertainty, Iran tensions, IT stocks: Treat the turbulence as buying opportunity, says Sameer Dalal
articles.summary: Indian markets navigate global uncertainties. Investors should see market turbulence as a buying chance. Tariff noise is manageable, but oil price spikes pose a real threat. Foreign investors continue selling, presenting an exit for them. The IT sector's valuation decline is largely over. Mid-sized private banks show promise despite a recent fraud incident.

articles.title: Rupee rises 21 paise to 90.73 against the US dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The Indian rupee strengthened significantly against the US dollar on Monday. This rise was driven by a sharp decline in global crude oil prices and a weaker dollar. Positive openings in domestic equity markets and increased forex reserves also supported the rupee. The dollar index saw a fall following a US Supreme Court decision on tariffs.

articles.title: Indian markets show signs of revival as broader market stage comeback: Devang Mehta
articles.summary: Indian equity markets show signs of recovery after an 18-month downturn, with improved market breadth and strong earnings growth across segments. Quality stocks are attracting renewed interest, and PSU banks offer attractive valuations and a dual proxy for India's growth story. The risk-reward balance now favors investors for selective accumulation.

articles.title: Maths and magic meet in Bengaluru as Dr. Martens scales global strategy
articles.summary: Dr. Martens established a Global Capability Centre in Bengaluru, India, to merge its heritage with a digital future. This strategic move, driven by CEO Ije Nwokorie's 'maths and magic' concept, leverages Indian talent for data, analytics, and innovation. The center aims to enhance global operations while preserving the brand's core values of individuality and craftsmanship.

articles.title: Powering the AI revolution: A Rs 200 lakh crore opportunity for capital markets
articles.summary: India’s AI revolution will rely less on code and more on massive infrastructure—power, fibre, cooling, chips, data centres and long-term capital. With a ₹200 lakh crore investment opportunity ahead, India’s maturing capital markets, REITs, InvITs and global investor appetite position the country to finance this next big private-sector-led buildout.

articles.title: Markets set for recovery? Siddharth Vora bets on largecaps, midcaps; flags metals, PSU banks, and cyclicals
articles.summary: India's equity markets present a contrarian opportunity as macro stability and bottoming earnings signal a constructive outlook, particularly for largecaps, midcaps, and cyclicals. Fund manager Siddharth Vora highlights multi-decadal underperformance versus global peers as a key indicator for potential outperformance, with his fund strategically overweighting metals, PSU banks, and energy.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | Only 16% IPOs beat market returns; be selective, says Ajay Tyagi who follows Warren Buffett

Investors are cautioned against IPO euphoria. Patience and selectivity are key to sustainable wealth. Valuations in mid and smallcaps remain a concern. Consumption and IT sectors show promise. FII ownership is currently low, offering comfort.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk: Range-bound markets ahead; prefer mid & smallcaps as earnings pick up in FY27–28: Mohit Khanna
articles.summary: Indian markets are navigating cross-currents post-Budget and policy announcements, with volatility expected to persist. Mohit Khanna of PGIM India AMC anticipates range-bound movement in the near term but sees strong earnings growth accelerating in FY27-28. He favors a bottom-up approach, with a constructive outlook on mid- and small-cap equities.

This 7.30 lakh sq ft development represents Nexus's first venture into an under-construction retail project. The mall will be part of the Runwal Garden City township, offering a ready customer base.

articles.title: India poised to capture big share of $800 bln APAC data centre boom: Deloitte
articles.summary: India can become a major data centre hub in Asia. This requires solving power and grid issues. Renewable energy integration must match digital growth. India has cost advantages and a skilled workforce. Government policies offer incentives. Data centre capacity will grow significantly by 2030. This expansion will increase electricity demand. Addressing these challenges will position India for digital leadership.

articles.title: India, Brazil have huge potential to grow trade: Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva
articles.summary: Lula highlighted the rapid growth in economic ties between the two countries and the untapped potential. In 2006, bilateral trade was only about $200 million, which rose to $2.4 billion a few years later, and reached $15 billion last year. "I have with me possibly the biggest delegation of ministers, businesspeople of all the different trips that I have taken up until now, and this shows the commitment that I have with India," said Lula.

articles.title: Jharkhand's economy projected to grow by 5.96% in 2026-27 fiscal: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Jharkhand's economy is set for growth. Projections show a 5.96 percent expansion in the 2026-27 fiscal year. This follows an estimated 6.17 percent growth in the previous year. Per capita income is expected to surpass one lakh rupees. The state's Gross State Domestic Product is also on an upward trajectory. These figures highlight a positive economic outlook for Jharkhand.

articles.title: Factory activity at three-mth high in February
articles.summary: India's private sector activity accelerated in February. The HSBC Flash Composite Output Index reached a three-month high. Manufacturing output saw sharper expansion, boosting overall growth. New orders and overseas demand supported this upturn. Businesses are optimistic about future activity. Employment growth also touched a three-month high as firms stepped up hiring.

articles.title: India core output slows to 4% in January
articles.summary: India's core sector growth slowed to 4% in January. Energy industries saw moderated momentum. Infrastructure sectors like cement and steel remained strong, reflecting economic investment. Electricity generation eased. Refinery products output was flat. Crude oil and natural gas production contracted. Coal and fertiliser output also saw slower growth. This slowdown is expected to impact overall industrial production.

articles.title: Base year for goods trade indices revised to '22-23
articles.summary: India's merchandise trade indices have a new base year, 2022-23, replacing the old 2012-13. This update reflects significant economic shifts and evolving trade patterns. The revised indices offer a more accurate picture of exports and imports. They are crucial for economic analysis and policy decisions. This revision enhances the relevance and reliability of trade data for all users.

articles.title: Sebi deploying AI to track influencers and insider trading in real time: Tuhin Kanta Pandey
articles.summary: Sebi Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the regulator is increasingly using artificial intelligence tools to monitor market misconduct, including insider trading, unregistered investment advice, and misleading financial promotions.

articles.title: Commodity Radar: Gold offers up to Rs 3,400 upside this week. LKP Securities expert lists 5 technical indicators in support
articles.summary: Domestic gold prices rallied to Rs 1,60,600 amid global tensions and tariff developments. LKP Securities expects up to Rs 3,400 upside this week, supported by key technical indicators including RSI, MACD, moving averages and Bollinger Bands. Analysts recommend a buy-on-dips strategy with defined support and resistance levels.

articles.title: India bonds stall on geopolitical risk, heavy supply
articles.summary: Indian government bonds traded narrowly as geopolitical tensions and a large debt supply weighed on demand. While easing oil price jitters offered some relief, traders remained cautious ahead of significant state and central government debt auctions. However, indications of potential future rate cuts from the central bank provided a slight boost to sentiment.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs raises oil price forecast for Q4 of 2026
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs has revised its 2026 crude oil forecasts upwards, anticipating Brent at $60 and WTI at $56 per barrel. This adjustment stems from lower-than-expected OECD stockpiles, even with assumptions of no Iran-related disruptions. The bank foresees OPEC+ gradually boosting production from early 2026, while maintaining a surplus prediction.

articles.title: Urban Company’s quick services vertical InstaHelp crosses 50,000 daily bookings
articles.summary: Launched as a pilot in Mumbai in March 2025, InstaHelp offers on-demand housekeeping services such as cleaning, dishwashing, laundry and meal preparation, promising fulfilment within 10-15 minutes of booking.

articles.title: AI-driven innovations dominate university-level robotics competition
articles.summary: The event was jointly organised by the University of Mumbai, the Centre of Excellence in Robotics Automation Process under the School of Engineering Applied Sciences, in collaboration with JANYU Technologies.

articles.title: What is Sarvam AI’s Indus: India’s answer to ChatGPT, Gemini-like chatbots?
articles.summary: Indian AI startup Sarvam.AI has launched Indus, a new chat interface. This chatbot is built on Sarvam's own 105 billion sovereign model. Indus is positioned as a competitor to global AI giants like OpenAI's ChatGPT and Google's Gemini. The company is currently focused on accuracy and usefulness for the Indian context.

articles.title: India-made robots shine at AI Impact Summit 2026 after early controversy
articles.summary: Indian-made robots captured attention at the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi. The SVAN-M2 robot dog from xTerra Robotics impressed attendees. A UNWFP robot designed for food warehouses also drew significant interest. These indigenous innovations showcased India's growing capabilities in artificial intelligence and robotics. The summit also saw a controversy regarding a university's misrepresentation of a foreign product.

articles.title: Tech leaders are all in on AI; the public, not so much
articles.summary: Silicon Valley touts AI as revolutionary, but public skepticism is high. Surveys show limited workplace impact, widespread fear, and strong support for regulation.

articles.title: Mistral sees AI as utility, emphasis more on efficiency: Founder Arthur Mensch
articles.summary: Indian entrepreneurs must run cos from own country to ensure innovation stays here, says founder Mensch.

articles.title: ‘Frugal’ Sarvam AI did a DeepSeek with just 40 researchers
articles.summary: Sarvam is already deploying its models in enterprise and government use cases, including voice AI and language technologies. Cofounder Pratyush Kumar said the company trained multiple models internally, without relying on any external technology stack.

articles.title: Indian IT captains hold firm amid raging agentic AI storm
articles.summary: K Krithivasan, chief executive officer and managing director of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), said while it’s not clear exactly what the roles will be a few years down the line due to disruption owing to AI, he does not envisage a “significant shrinkage” to TCS and the industry at large.

articles.title: Balancing AI and copyright; Adani's $100B bet
articles.summary: Day 2 of the India AI Impact Summit featured additional announcements, sessions, and policy discussions focused on emerging technology. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Passenger vehicle sales keep the momentum in Jan, rise in double digits for a 4th month
articles.summary: Indian auto sales are off to a strong start in the new year. Passenger vehicle sales saw double-digit growth for the fourth month running in January. Two- and three-wheeler segments also posted significant gains. This positive trend indicates sustained demand and supports economic activity across the country. The automotive sector is poised for continued growth.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI is about to be everywhere—and India is ready
articles.summary: AI is moving beyond the cloud into smartphones, cars, wearables and factories, becoming ambient and personal—with India uniquely positioned to shape its future—argues Cristiano Amon, President and CEO, Qualcomm

articles.title: India must invest in children, skills and manufacturing to harness demographic dividend: BVR Subrahmanyam
articles.summary: BVR Subrahmanyam at AIMA stresses India's growth, urging investment in skills, manufacturing, agriculture, FDI, and climate tech for sustained progress.

articles.title: AI won’t kill India’s services economy, it will upgrade it: Vijay Shekhar Sharma
articles.summary: Vijay Shekhar Sharma believes AI will expand India’s services economy, transforming BPOs into global healthcare providers and reshaping finance with AI-powered advisory and underwriting.

articles.title: Tomato, onion and potato price shocks drive bulk of inflation volatility: RBI study
articles.summary: Vegetable price spikes, especially in tomato, onion and potato, account for over 80% of recent headline inflation volatility, according to a Reserve Bank of India study.

articles.title: India revises base year of merchandise trade indices to FY23 to reflect changing trade patterns
articles.summary: DGCI S has updated India’s Merchandise Trade Indices base year to 2022-23, reflecting current trade patterns. Prof. Nachiketa Chattopadhyay chaired the revision committee.

articles.title: Strong manufacturing growth lifts India's private sector in February, PMI shows
articles.summary: HSBC India Composite PMI rose to 59.3 in February, boosted by manufacturing and steady services. Rising input costs signaled inflation concerns.

articles.title: India’s FTAs now unlock 70% of global GDP, says Piyush Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal highlights India’s nine FTAs, including with the United States, boosting export access to 70 percent of global GDP. Bharat Mart in Dubai and AI Summit investments drive growth.

articles.title: India’s core sector growth slips to 4% in January; momentum eases from December high
articles.summary: India’s core sector growth slowed to 4% in January 2026, with steel and cement expanding strongly while coal, crude oil, and natural gas production weakened, signaling broad-based moderation.

articles.title: Indian IT stocks not yet bargain buys, says Bandhan AMC's Manish Gunwani
articles.summary: Manish Gunwani, Head – Equity at Bandhan AMC prefers manufacturing and export-oriented sectors over consumption, and believes investors can expect 6–7% real returns when markets trade at fair value.

articles.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei: AI could transform India’s economy, but disruption must be managed
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei said AI has the potential to lift millions out of poverty and significantly expand India’s economic growth. However, he cautioned that the technology could also cause disruption, calling for close coordination with governments to manage its impact.

articles.title: Nirmala Sitharaman meets Norwegian CEOs to discuss India investment scope
articles.summary: Speaking at the session with 35 Norwegian CEOs and investors in Oslo, FM Nirmala Sitharaman said, 'My official visit to Norway has witnessed engaging and positive discussions on India as an investment destination and the fastest growing major economy of the world.'

articles.title: AI is a 'civilisational change': N Chandrasekaran sees big opportunity for India’s IT
articles.summary: Calling AI a civilisation-scale shift, N Chandrasekaran says enterprise adoption will unlock latent demand, positioning India’s IT services firms for large-scale transformation opportunities.

articles.title: Food Secretary: India's sugar supply "comfortably" placed despite production estimates down by 13 LT
articles.summary: India's sugar production is estimated at 330 LT, with consumption at 290 LT, ensuring surplus. AISTA reports 2.01 LT exports in 2025-26, mainly to UAE, Afghanistan, Djibouti, and Bhutan.

articles.title: Gokaldas Exports expects 12-15% revenue growth in FY27 as US sourcing returns
articles.summary: Gokaldas Exports is expanding in Europe and continuing diversification. It also plans capex of around ₹175 crore over two years and is open to expansion through acquisitions. Management said trade deals and tariff normalisation could support textile exports and jobs growth.

articles.title: Coal India's Gevra block in Chhattisgarh to become the world's top mine by next year: Top official
articles.summary: Gevra mine, operated by SECL, will become the world's top coal-producing mine in 2026-27 with 63 million tonnes, surpassing Black Thunder Mine in the US, and plans solar and gasification projects.

articles.title: Ex-Sequoia Capital India arm raises $1.3 billion after key exits
articles.summary: Peak XV Partners raised 1.3 billion dollars for AI and consumer startups in India and South East Asia, led by Shailendra Singh, after splitting from Sequoia Capital in 2023.

articles.title: Qualcomm to make automotive modules in India at Tata’s $3 billion Assam plant
articles.summary: Qualcomm Technologies has partnered with Tata Electronics to manufacture automotive modules in India at its upcoming OSAT facility in Assam, aiming to meet demand from Indian and global automakers.

articles.title: Statiq raises $18 million, eyes UAE expansion and more highway EV chargers
articles.summary: EV charging firm Statiq has secured about $18 million in equity and debt led by Tenacity Ventures to expand its network across India, add highway fast chargers, and begin overseas expansion.

articles.title: Oil surges to six-month high on US-Iran conflict worries
articles.summary: Oil prices hit six-month highs as Brent settled at $71.66 and WTI at $66.43, driven by US Iran tensions, Strait of Hormuz drills, Saudi export drop, and strong US crude demand.

articles.title: Nykaa to bring viral Korean skincare brand medicube to India
articles.summary: Nykaa has teamed up with South Korea’s APR Corporation to bring viral skincare brand medicube to India, expanding its Korean beauty portfolio across online and offline channels.

articles.title: Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam gets 'battery torch' symbol
articles.summary: The Election Commission of India allotted the Battery Torch symbol to Makkal Needhi Maiam for the 2026 Puducherry polls. Kamal Haasan leads MNM, which campaigned for the DMK-led INDIA bloc.

articles.title: PM Modi’s visit doubled devotee footfall at Tripura Sundari Temple: CM Manik Saha
articles.summary: Tripura CM Manik Saha said devotee footfall at Tripura Sundari Temple doubled after PM Narendra Modi’s visit and redevelopment of the Shakti Peetha shrine in Gomati district.

articles.title: PM Modi's Mann Ki Baat Highlights: Episode 131 from Vocal for Local to AI in Agriculture
articles.summary: PM Modi addresses the nation in the 131st Mann Ki Baat episode, sharing thoughts on national issues and inspiring stories, broadcast on Akashvani, Doordarshan and digital platforms.

articles.title: Piyush Goyal calls for greater ambition to deepen India–Brazil economic ties
articles.summary: Says bilateral trade at $15 billion remains below potential; highlights Brazil’s strategic importance, India’s expanding FTAs, and scope for stronger cooperation.

articles.title: India showcases naval strength in Visakhapatnam, signaling to China
articles.summary: With Ex-MILAN and International Fleet Review, India this week demonstrated its naval prowess and strategic alignment, bringing together the US, Russian and Iranian navies under one umbrella in a signal to China.

articles.title: Uttar Pradesh couple sentenced to death for sexual exploitation of 33 children
articles.summary: A POCSO court has directed the Uttar Pradesh government to pay ₹10 lakh each in compensation to all the 33 victims.

articles.title: ElevenLabs sees India as key market for voice AI growth, targets expansion in enterprise adoption
articles.summary: Speaking at the AI Impact Summit, Staniszewski said India has become one of the company’s most important markets, driven by early adoption of voice-based technology.

articles.title: Arundhati Bhattacharya sees faster AI adoption in India as enterprises await clear returns
articles.summary: The Salesforce CEO said that concerns around job losses in frontline sales and service roles may be overstated, as these positions are more likely to evolve than disappear.

articles.title: India has leapfrogged other countries in AI adoption, says Adobe’s Shantanu Narayen
articles.summary: Shantanu Narayen, CEO of Adobe, said the company has integrated AI across its entire product portfolio and has also introduced AI-first offerings such as Firefly and Express.

articles.title: AI 'answer engines' could upend internet's ad-driven business model: Cloudflare
articles.summary: Matthew Prince, CEO of Cloudflare, Inc., said India represents a significant growth opportunity as the country accelerates efforts to build sovereign AI infrastructure.

articles.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: Tech Mahindra launches education-focused Hindi AI model
articles.summary: The model was developed using NVIDIA's advanced AI frameworks and infrastructure, including the NVIDIA NeMo framework and deployment via NVIDIA NIM microservices.

articles.title: Gulf Oil sees small but growing data centre cooling market
articles.summary: Manish Gangwal, Whole-Time Director and CFO of Gulf Oil Lubricants India, said that while the opportunity is futuristic and important for high-density data centres, the addressable market remains small—about 1–2% of the overall lubricant industry—and current revenue contribution is negligible.

articles.title: Gaganyaan Drogue Parachute clears qualification load test at DRDO’s RTRS facility
articles.summary: The test proves India’s expertise in designing and manufacturing of high strength ribbon parachutes, says Ministry of Defence

articles.title: Military power is shifting from weapons to algorithms, says defence research paper on India’s AI doctrine
articles.summary: As global military AI spending surges, here's how India’s “Trustworthy AI” doctrine contrasts sharply with the aggressive AI-First approach of the United States and China’s Military-Civil Fusion strategy, highlighting a widening investment and capability gap.

articles.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: Bejul Somaia says India’s AI story is about speed, not starting point
articles.summary: At the AI Impact Summit 2026, Bejul Somaia said India’s AI future will be defined by speed of adoption, engineering depth and execution — not infrastructure gaps.

articles.title: UTI AMC’s Sharwan Goyal sees quant strategies reshaping India’s equity markets
articles.summary: Sharwan Goyal of UTI AMC says quant strategies are transforming India’s equity markets with data-driven, adaptive multi-factor investing.

articles.title: JM Financial Asset Management launches ₹1,500 crore Category II Pre-IPO AIF
articles.summary: JM Financial Asset Management launches ₹1,500 crore Pre-IPO AIF, approved by SEBI, managed by Jaisinh Suchak, targeting companies listing within 18 months amid growing AIF industry in India.

articles.title: Gold jewellery reported missing from Punjab National Bank locker in Delhi’s Kirti Nagar
articles.summary: Delhi Police are investigating missing gold jewellery from a Punjab National Bank locker in Tagore Market, Kirti Nagar. No signs of forced entry found; CCTV and records are being examined.

articles.title: Those who don't believe in spiritual gurus are rascals: Madras High Court judge
articles.summary: Those who don't believe in spiritual gurus are rascals: Madras High Court judge

articles.title: The invisible cost of AI drift in Indian enterprises
articles.summary: As AI becomes more embedded into everyday workflows, drift goes from being a technical concern to an operational and business risk.

articles.title: Indian universities showcase their AI strengths at India AI Impact Summit 2026
articles.summary: In our fourth photo essay from the India AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, we showcase 12 pavilions by Indian universities.

articles.title: Scaling deeptech manufacturing needs a different capital logic
articles.summary: India has the technical depth and policy backing to lead across multiple deeptech verticals. What remains is the harder task of building financial discipline that matches the patience the technologies require.

articles.title: AI Impact Summit: States of India showcase their AI strengths
articles.summary: In our third photo essay from the India AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, we showcase a range of pavilions by Indian states.

articles.title: Hamirpur’s Nagra Jutis: Crafting Identity, One Pair at a Time
articles.summary: Shyam Babu and Hamirpur’s Nagra juti makers preserve handmade leather footwear, adapting tradition to modern demand and evolving supply chains.

articles.title: India AI Summit draws $250B infrastructure commitments, $20B VC deeptech investments
articles.summary: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said the summit saw participation from over 5 lakh visitors, reflecting strong domestic and global engagement with India's AI push.

articles.title: Adobe’s mission to empower creators; Women redefining entrepreneurship
articles.summary: Shantanu Narayen, CEO of Adode, positions AI as a technology that removes barriers to expression and creativity. Meanwhile, across India, women are building enterprises that create impact and market opportunities for countless women, both in urban and rural areas.

articles.title: India unveils ‘MANAS 1’: AI trained on 60,000 hours of brainwaves aims to detect disorders early
articles.summary: An Indian team has developed MANAS 1, an AI model trained on extensive brainwave data to detect neurological and psychiatric disorders early. This foundational platform, built on 60,000 hours of recordings, aims to interpret the brain's electrical signals, potentially aiding doctors in remote areas and reducing diagnostic delays for conditions like epilepsy and dementia. A next-generation version is anticipated soon.

articles.title: ET Explainer: What will US tariff be now?
articles.summary: Following an agreement on a framework for an interim trade deal earlier this month, the US announced it will cut the reciprocal tariff on India to 18% and remove the additional 25% punitive tariffs. Currently, India's goods exports to the US are subject to 25% reciprocal tariff. The February 6 joint statement on the framework for an interim deal proposed lowering this rate to 18% but the change has yet to be implemented.

articles.title: More About That Chinese Nuclear Test . . .
articles.summary: Beijing and Moscow build their arsenals while the U.S. restrains itself.

articles.title: Lutyens' statue removal latest in Modi's anti-colonial project: Know who he was, and how his name came to spell elitism
articles.summary: "The country is leaving behind the symbols of slavery and has begun to value symbols related to Indian culture," Modi said in latest episode of Mann Ki Baat.

articles.title: Tejas fighter jet suffers major damage after overshooting runway, brake failure suspected: Report
articles.summary: The Tejas aircraft was reportedly returning to base after carrying out a training sortie when it encountered a suspected brake failure.

articles.title: Mukul Roy dies at 71: His journey from Trinamool's backroom brain to BJP strategist
articles.summary: A close aide of Mamata Banerjee, Mukul Roy was considered the second-most powerful leader in the Trinamool Congress during its formative years.

articles.title: The first house in Delhi's Kautilya Marg and its Bauhaus history
articles.summary: Tracing the soul of a city through its homes, this column looks at houses as living archives of the millions of people who make Delhi

articles.title: Kodak launches 65-inch Mini LED 4K smart TV in India with six speakers at Rs…
articles.summary: Kodak has launched its first Mini LED TV in India, featuring a 65-inch screen, 108W speakers, Google TV support and gaming features.

articles.title: Air India extends New York, Newark flight cancellations to Feb 24 amid blizzard
articles.summary: The airline said that airport operations at New York and Newark have been affected due to the blizzard leading to heavy snowfall.

articles.title: Recalling Bandung 1955 in push to democratise AI
articles.summary: If the Bandung conference was the cry of the hungry, then the India AI Impact Summit is the roar of a rapidly-progressing India

articles.title: Talent in the AI age: Code coolies to core engineers
articles.summary: AI is now forcing a reckoning, because the playing field has shifted, and for the first time in centuries, India has the tools to build its own future

articles.summary: This article is authored by Prabhu Dayal, former ambassador, New Delhi.

articles.title: What are colour aberrations in mammals? [Explainer]
articles.summary: On the morning of January 3, 2026, wildlife biologist Sanjay Gubbi posted on social media that an “ultra-rare” leopard colour morph had been recorded in Karnataka’s Vijayanagara district for the first time. The camera trap image obtained by Gubbi and his team at the Holématthi Nature Foundation (HNF) showed an Indian leopard (Panthera pardus fusca) [ ]
